What We're Looking For:
2U’s Placement team is vital in the student enrollment lifecycle in identifying externship sites and matching this real world field work to students as a part of their Master’s curricula.  The Placement team is focused on providing white glove customer service to students, faculty and university partners.
The Placement Specialist I will form relationships with both students and externship sites where students can acquire hands-on learning and experience in their chosen field. The person in this role will be responsible for building new relationships and maintaining existing partnerships with placement sites through high outreach.  Additionally, The Placement Specialist I is focused on building relationships with students to ensure their success and retention in the program by focusing on on-time placement and providing quality, faculty-approved experiences for each student. 
Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:

Developing new partnerships and maintaining relationships with sites for placements (20%)
Matching sites with students and placing them with a sense of urgency to prevent any lapse in class registration (20%)
Providing exceptional service to students throughout the placement cycle (20%)
Creating individual strategy for long term placement relationships as well as fulfilling “one off” placement requirements for students with an emphasis on developing placements within a particular region of the country (20%)
Providing consistent and professional communication to students throughout the entire placement process via phone and email. (20%)

Things That Should Be in Your Background:

Bachelor’s degree
1-2 years of work experience
Strong time management and organizational skills
Previous experience in a fast paced, metrics driven environment
Previous experience in a customer service oriented environment
Comfort in communicating and establishing rapport in a professional manner across the following mediums: phone, email, video conference and in-person
Good judgment and excellent organizational, communication (oral and written), and interpersonal skills 
Highly self-motivated and able to work autonomously
Strong sense of system orientation and focus on providing “white glove” service to students and faculty
Enthusiasm and the ability to thrive in an atmosphere of constant change
Ability to work and contribute in a team environment

About 2U Inc. (NASDAQ: TWOU)
2U is comprised of 3 lines of business: Graduate Degree Programs, Short Course, and Boot Camps. Going beyond traditional learning management systems, we use tech, people, and data to help top universities and enterprise organizations transform in the digital era—and eliminate the back row in higher ed. We support lifelong learning which means thinking beyond a single degree. It means finding ways for students to gain the skills they need to change careers, evolve their expertise, and meet the challenges of the changing world head-on. We help our partners fill those needs—developing new digital education technologies and offerings capable of supporting students at different points in their lives. Whether they need a simple refresher, to learn something new, or to change their career trajectories completely, our partners are there to help them succeed. Together with our partners, 2U has positively transformed the lives of more than 275,000 students and lifelong learners.
